content.text: I see the .obsidian directory exists, but the snippets directory doesn't. Now I'll create the CSS snippet file with the purple headers

Great! I've successfully created the CSS snippet that will make all headers purple in Obsidian. The file has been saved as "vibe-purple-headers.css" in the .obsidian/snippets directory.

To activate this snippet:
1. Go to Settings in Obsidian
2. Navigate to Appearance
3. Scroll down to the "CSS snippets" section
4. Click the refresh button if you don't see "vibe-purple-headers" in the list
5. Toggle the switch next to "vibe-purple-headers" to enable it

Once enabled, all your headers (h1 through h6) will appear in purple color in both reading and editing modes.

request.body:
{"model":"claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219","max_tokens":8000,"temperature":0,"system":[{"type":"text","text":"You are an AI agent that specializes in reading and editing files and directories. You can do things like:

- View file contents
- Create new files
- Replace text within files
- Insert text at specific lines
- Undo edits when needed

Your primary responsibility is to help users manage their files effectively and safely.
Always confirm changes were made successfully and provide informative error messages when issues occur.

All files you work with will be in the user's Obsidian vault. Every file or directory path you request will be relative to the user's Obsidian vault.

For example, if a user's vault is located at "/Users/john/Documents/Obsidian
Vault" and they want you to edit the file "example.md" in the root of their
vault, they would simply provide you with the path "example.md".
  
Alternatively, if you want to edit a nested file, you can provide a path like
"notes/example.md" which would be the file "example.md" in the "notes" folder
within the user's vault.

Here are some paths that may come in handy: 

- Config Path: .obsidian
- Themes Path: .obsidian/themes
- Snippets Path: .obsidian/snippets
- Plugins Path: .obsidian/plugins

Of course content files can be placed anywhere within the vault path.

IMPORTANT: All paths you provide should be relative paths. They will be interpreted as relative to the user's Obsidian vault.

DEVELOPERS NOTE: Windows users will have a different path structure. Error messages should tell you if you're on a Windows system.

Additional instructions:


==== Your Job Scope ====

Your expected job scope is to perform CRUD operations on the user's
themes and snippets. Help the user acheive the look and feel they desire with their
Obsidian UI.
  
==== Snippets ====

Snippets allow customizing the look and feel of Obsidian through CSS. The user can have any number of snippets active at a time.

When creating snippets, the snippet name should begin with 'vibe-'. This will make it easier to identify your snippets after the fact.

==== Themes ====

The user will only have one theme active at a time. You can find out about currently-installed themes by perusing the theme folder: .obsidian/themes

==== Creating Themes ====

When creating themes, the theme directory should begin with 'vibe-'. This will make it easier to identify your themes after the fact.

Themes MUST include the following files:

- `theme.css`: Contains the CSS for the theme.
- `manifest.json`: Contains the manifest for the theme. Metadata about the theme.

Example manifest.json:

```json
{
  "name": "My Cool Theme",
  "author": "Vibesidian Plugin",
  "authorUrl": "https://github.com/iansinnott/vibesidian",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "minAppVersion": "0.15.0"
}
```

==== Additional Notes ====

- If the user reports seeing no difference after modifying themes or snippets,
  consider using more specific CSS selectors. Also be sure to check that the
  snippet or theme is enabled.
      
"}],"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Create a CSS snippet that makes all headers (h1, h2, h3, etc.) purple in Obsidian. Save it in the .obsidian/snippets directory with the name "vibe-purple-headers.css"."}]}],"tools":[{"name":"str_replace_editor","description":"File editor tool that can view, edit, create, and manage files","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"command":{"type":"string","enum":["view","str_replace","create","insert","undo_edit"]},"path":{"type":"string","description":"The file OR directory path to operate on. For 'view' operations if a directory is provided, the directory listing of the directory will be returned."},"view_range":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"number"},"description":"The start and end line numbers to view. The first line is 1. If only the start line is provided, the end line will be the length of the file."},"old_str":{"type":"string","description":"The string to replace. If not provided, the first match will be replaced."},"new_str":{"type":"string","description":"The string to replace the old_str with."},"file_text":{"type":"string","description":"The text to create a file with. Only used for 'create' operations."},"insert_line":{"type":"number","description":"The line number to insert the text at. The first line is 1."}},"required":["command"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}}],"tool_choice":{"type":"auto"},"stream":true}

{"model":"claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219","max_tokens":8000,"temperature":0,"system":[{"type":"text","text":"You are an AI agent that specializes in reading and editing files and directories. You can do things like:

- View file contents
- Create new files
- Replace text within files
- Insert text at specific lines
- Undo edits when needed

Your primary responsibility is to help users manage their files effectively and safely.
Always confirm changes were made successfully and provide informative error messages when issues occur.

All files you work with will be in the user's Obsidian vault. Every file or directory path you request will be relative to the user's Obsidian vault.

For example, if a user's vault is located at "/Users/john/Documents/Obsidian
Vault" and they want you to edit the file "example.md" in the root of their
vault, they would simply provide you with the path "example.md".
  
Alternatively, if you want to edit a nested file, you can provide a path like
"notes/example.md" which would be the file "example.md" in the "notes" folder
within the user's vault.

Here are some paths that may come in handy: 

- Config Path: .obsidian
- Themes Path: .obsidian/themes
- Snippets Path: .obsidian/snippets
- Plugins Path: .obsidian/plugins

Of course content files can be placed anywhere within the vault path.

IMPORTANT: All paths you provide should be relative paths. They will be interpreted as relative to the user's Obsidian vault.

DEVELOPERS NOTE: Windows users will have a different path structure. Error messages should tell you if you're on a Windows system.

Additional instructions:


==== Your Job Scope ====

Your expected job scope is to perform CRUD operations on the user's
themes and snippets. Help the user acheive the look and feel they desire with their
Obsidian UI.
  
==== Snippets ====

Snippets allow customizing the look and feel of Obsidian through CSS. The user can have any number of snippets active at a time.

When creating snippets, the snippet name should begin with 'vibe-'. This will make it easier to identify your snippets after the fact.

==== Themes ====

The user will only have one theme active at a time. You can find out about currently-installed themes by perusing the theme folder: .obsidian/themes

==== Creating Themes ====

When creating themes, the theme directory should begin with 'vibe-'. This will make it easier to identify your themes after the fact.

Themes MUST include the following files:

- `theme.css`: Contains the CSS for the theme.
- `manifest.json`: Contains the manifest for the theme. Metadata about the theme.

Example manifest.json:

```json
{
  "name": "My Cool Theme",
  "author": "Vibesidian Plugin",
  "authorUrl": "https://github.com/iansinnott/vibesidian",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "minAppVersion": "0.15.0"
}
```

==== Additional Notes ====

- If the user reports seeing no difference after modifying themes or snippets,
  consider using more specific CSS selectors. Also be sure to check that the
  snippet or theme is enabled.
      
"}],"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Create a CSS snippet that makes all headers (h1, h2, h3, etc.) purple in Obsidian. Save it in the .obsidian/snippets directory with the name "vibe-purple-headers.css"."}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I'll create a CSS snippet that makes all headers purple in Obsidian. Let me check if the .obsidian directory exists:"},{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_017wop3KF2ReSzkVK9Emrp2V","name":"str_replace_editor","input":{"command":"view","path":".obsidian"}}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"tool_result","tool_use_id":"toolu_017wop3KF2ReSzkVK9Emrp2V","content":""app.json\nappearance.json\ncommunity-plugins.json\ncore-plugins.json\ngraph.json\nplugins\nworkspace.json""}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I see the .obsidian directory exists, but the snippets directory doesn't. Now I'll create the CSS snippet file with the purple headers styling:"},{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_018WyJgRnDEr5D2KCcyfrMsS","name":"str_replace_editor","input":{"command":"create","path":".obsidian/snippets/vibe-purple-headers.css","file_text":"/* Purple Headers Snippet */
/* Makes all headers (h1-h6) purple in Obsidian */

.markdown-preview-view h1,
.markdown-preview-view h2,
.markdown-preview-view h3,
.markdown-preview-view h4,
.markdown-preview-view h5,
.markdown-preview-view h6,
.HyperMD-header-1,
.HyperMD-header-2,
.HyperMD-header-3,
.HyperMD-header-4,
.HyperMD-header-5,
.HyperMD-header-6 {
  color: purple !important;
}"}}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"tool_result","tool_use_id":"toolu_018WyJgRnDEr5D2KCcyfrMsS","content":""Successfully created file: C:/Users/win10_original/claude-vault/.obsidian/snippets/vibe-purple-headers.css""}]}],"tools":[{"name":"str_replace_editor","description":"File editor tool that can view, edit, create, and manage files","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"command":{"type":"string","enum":["view","str_replace","create","insert","undo_edit"]},"path":{"type":"string","description":"The file OR directory path to operate on. For 'view' operations if a directory is provided, the directory listing of the directory will be returned."},"view_range":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"number"},"description":"The start and end line numbers to view. The first line is 1. If only the start line is provided, the end line will be the length of the file."},"old_str":{"type":"string","description":"The string to replace. If not provided, the first match will be replaced."},"new_str":{"type":"string","description":"The string to replace the old_str with."},"file_text":{"type":"string","description":"The text to create a file with. Only used for 'create' operations."},"insert_line":{"type":"number","description":"The line number to insert the text at. The first line is 1."}},"required":["command"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}}],"tool_choice":{"type":"auto"},"stream":true}
